_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY



The accidental release prevention and emergency response policies at your facility: This

facility complies with the National Fire Protection Association's Liquefied Petroleum Gas Code

(NFPA 58). It is Automated Solutions, LLC's (AS's) policy to adhere to all applicable federal,

state, and local laws. If an emergency were to occur, AS's policy is to notify the City of Lenoir

Fire Department and request that they respond to the emergency.



A description of your facility and the regulated substances handled: This facility manufactures

polyethylene (PE) foam. Isobutane is used in PE foam manufacturing. The regulated process

consists of one 12,000-gallon isobutane storage tank and associated PE foam manufacturing

equipment.



The worst-case and alternative release scenarios: AS's worst-case scenario is failure of a full

12,000-gallon storage tank resulting in a vapor cloud explosion. The resulting distance to the

endpoint extends offsite and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint. AS's

alternative release scenario is a break in a 2-inch diameter pipe handling the vapor phase leading

to a 60-minute release and vapor cloud explosion. The resulting distance to the endpoint extends

offsite and public receptors are within the distance to the endpoint. No administrative controls

and mitigation measures where used to limit the impacts of the reported scenarios.



The general accidental release prevention program and chemical-specific prevention steps:

This facility complies with EPA's accident prevention rule, the Occupational Safety and Health

Administration's Process Safety Management standard, and all applicable state and local codes

and regulations. The isobutane system is designed, installed and maintained in accordance with

NFPA-58 and state law.



Five-year accident history: AS has never had an accident involving isobutane that caused

deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations or shelterin

gs in place.



The emergency response program: In the event of an emergency involving the isobutane

system, it is AS's policy to notify the City of Lenoir Fire Department and request that they

respond to the emergency. AS has coordinated its response plans with the fire department and

members of the fire department have inspected the facility.



Planned changes to improve safety: None.
